name: Mweya Safari Lodge

reviews.text: We stayed at Mweya for 3 nights, initially I was a little disapointed when shown to our room. I had seen some photo's somewhere on-line but they were obviously of the suite with a private verandah. The basic rooms are in a block so the outside space would not feel terribly intimate. The room itself was perfectly fine. If you wanted to be very picky you may say the bathroom was a little tired but perfectly clean and adequate. I loved the walk-in mosquito netting and the bed was big and comfortable.
reviews.title: Amazing location

likes.disliked: — verandah outside room wasn't very private

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was great, such a fantastic view over the kazinga channel, also the outside verandah of the restaurant offered the same views.
reviews.title: Ugandan Holiday Camp

likes.disliked: — The rooms and the unhelpful staff

reviews.text: The food was great, coffee in the morning before a drive, big buffet selection at breakfast, choose from a varied lunch menu and then either a buffet or set menu for the evening meal.
reviews.title: Fantastic experience

likes.disliked: — the locks were stiff (how feeble a complaint is that?)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were friendly and professional at all times. We missed lunch on our first day and were informed that we could have a packed lunch on the day of departure. On our final evening a member of staff sought us out and offered us a choice of 4 packed lunches for the next day! A fairly small thing perhaps but it's the little things that make all the difference.
reviews.title: Great Location, OK Facility

reviews.text: We had high hopes for this place and we were sorely disappointed from the moment we arrived. This place is stuck in a 1970's time warp with plastic still on the chairs. All rooms were in a block and of very poor quality. The room was old, tatty and basic with plastic like bedspread and curtains. The bathroom towels and little grey and worn. The pool area was fine but the woman at the pool area was hopeless. We found the staff to be fed up and not very helpful (I suppose I would be if I was stuck in the middle of nowhere). Reception staff apart from Solomon, the reception manager were hopeless and totally unhelpful. The food and restaurant area was ok with a good selection. The whole resort felt like a 1970's holiday camp and I can't believe other reviews have said it was amazing and one of the best places they have stayed - they need to get out more.
reviews.title: Spectacular in every way!

reviews.text: Absolutely stunning location! Must stay if you are at Elizabeth Park.
reviews.title: Stunning!

reviews.text: Rooms all with view over Kazinga channel, spacious and very clean indeed. I found the service excellent, even special requests were no trouble at all for the professional and very friendly staff. The food

reviews.text: The Mweya Lodge overlooks the Kazinga Channel and has amazing views of the channel and wildlife. It has an infinity pool and an outdoor restaurant where weaver birds fly all around you and landing on your table. The setting is amazing.
reviews.title: Simply Stunning
Spectacular...Must Visit
reviews.text: Mweya Safari Lodge is spectacularly located with incredible reviews as far as the eye can see with the Mountains of the Moon visible on a clear day.The Lodge it self is tasteful decorated and the rooms are most comfortable.Service couldn't be better...the staff very friendly to kids.Food was good and the breakfasts worth a mention.

We have to agree, that this is a great spot! We were so very well taken care of! 3 meals a day were included with the room charge, and the meals were outstanding--rivaling any plush hotel anywhere. They varied the buffet all you can eat menu nightly, so you never got tired. The dining room was lovely and it provided a very relaxing place to congregate every evening for dinner and every morning for breakfast. Ask for African Tea and you won't be disappointed. The safari itself was disappointing, no giraffes or zebras and the lions were scarce or hiding. Lots of hippos though in Lake Edward for up close and personal views, same with hyenas and elephants-whole herds. The room was very nice, and they sprayed well and the mosquito netting was kept up to date--no holes. My family enjoyed staying here for two nights and have fond memories. All in all a great place in Uganda to visit and relax and provide lifetime memories. oh yeh, one more thing, when you arrive, they greet you with a cool towel to wipe your brow, and a cool shrub (mixed juices)just what was needed. In the morning before your safari you gather for English Tea in nice china cups and the gift shop is very nice and not overly priced! Do some shopping, but ifyou see something, buy it right away, because they are all one of a kind!!!
reviews.title: Have to agree--Great Place!
It just doesn't get any better than this
reviews.text: The best spot in the world, and I've been all over the globe. Situated on a peninsula in Queen Elizabeth National Park, the scenery can't be beaten. I've stayed here several times and have fond memories of each trip. Wart hogs wander the grounds, not bothered by guests. At night, you can hear the hippo munching grass just outside your room. The roar of lions from deep inside the park echoes across the water, and the birdlife is spectacular. The staff are wonderful, although food service can be a bit slow, they surely try. You can swim in the beautiful pool while looking out at buffalo, hippo, elephants, and other wildlife on the shores of the Kazinga channel below. Watch the sun rise and set over the water and varied plant life of the park. A magical, mystical place not to be missed!

aka: Mweya Safari Hotel Queen Elizabeth National Park
